result.execSummary:
The defendant Desiree Lynn Harms was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber and good time - to begin on or before 9:00 a.m. on Monday, November 21, 2022.  Court is not opposed to electronic monitoring.
A payment plan can be set up with the Clerk's Of Courts for those assessments, fees and surcharges. If payments are not made, a civil judgement, with interest, may be ordered.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desiree Lynn Harms

records.addlTxt: 10:04 AM - case called.  Defendant Desiree Lynn Harms in court.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Desiree Lynn Harms.  Attorney Kristopher Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smith regarding plea agreement.  Court questions Atty Smith/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Smith/Defendant.  Plea to Count 1 is no contest.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Found guilty by the Court.  Joint recommendation.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Statement by Atty Ellis/Atty Smith/Court regarding sentencing.  Court orders 60 days in the Lincoln County Jail with Huber and good time - 3 days sentence credit - to begin on or before 9:00 a.m. on Monday, November 21, 2022 - Court is not opposed to electronic monitoring, and cc/sc to be paid in 60 days upon completion of jail sentence unless payment arraignments are made with the Court.  Post conviction rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:02 AM - case called.  Defendant Desiree Lynn Harms not in court.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Desiree Lynn Harms.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Parties are ready to set a PLEAS.  Statement by the Court.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
